statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content:
Mex is a function on a set of integers, which is universally used for impartial game theorem. For a non-negative integer set S, mex(S) is defined as the least non-negative integer which is not appeared in S. Now our problem is about mex function on a sequence.

Consider a sequence of non-negative integers {ai}, we define mex(L,R) as the least non-negative integer which is not appeared in the continuous subsequence from aL to aR, inclusive. Now we want to calculate the sum of mex(L,R) for all 1 <= L <= R <= n.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The input contains at most 20 test cases.
For each test case, the first line contains one integer n, denoting the length of sequence.
The next line contains n non-integers separated by space, denoting the sequence.
(1 <= n <= 200000, 0 <= ai <= 10^9)
The input ends with n = 0.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, output one line containing a integer denoting the answer.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
5
24

Hint

For the first test case:
mex(1,1)=1, mex(1,2)=2, mex(1,3)=2, mex(2,2)=0, mex(2,3)=0,mex(3,3)=0.
 1 + 2 + 2 + 0 +0 +0 = 5.
